components.name: java client
components.description: The java client interface for ZooKeeper

fields.description:
On OpenJDK, {{javax.security.auth.login.Configuration.getConfiguration}} does not throw an exception.  {{ZooKeeperSaslClient.clientTunneledAuthenticationInProgress}} uses an exception from that method as a proxy for "this client is not configured to use SASL" and as a result no commands can be sent, since it is still waiting for auth to complete.

[Link to mailing list discussion|http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.comp.java.zookeeper.user/2667]

The relevant bit of logs from OpenJDK and Oracle versions of 'connect and do getChildren("/")':

{code:title=OpenJDK}

DEBUG [main] 2012-09-25 14:02:24,548 com.socrata.zookeeper.ZooKeeperProvider Waiting for connected-state...
INFO [main-SendThread(mike.local:2181)] 2012-09-25 14:02:24,576 org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn Opening socket connection to server mike.local/10.0.2.106:2181. Will not attempt to authenticate using SASL (unknown error)
INFO [main-SendThread(mike.local:2181)] 2012-09-25 14:02:24,584 org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn Socket connection established to mike.local/10.0.2.106:2181, initiating session

DEBUG [main-EventThread] 2012-09-25 14:02:24,614 com.socrata.zookeeper.ZooKeeperProvider ConnectionStateChanged(Connected)

fields.summary: ZooKeeperSaslClient does not finish anonymous login on OpenJDK

comments.body: Robert mentions in mailing list thread linked above that this bug happens on both Openjdk 6 and Openjdk 7 on Ubuntu and Debian Linux.

It seems that, unlike Oracle's JDK 6, OpenJDK 6 returns a non-null value from javax.security.auth.login.Configuration.getConfiguration(), even if the user hasn't explicitly set a login configuration. This patch tests for both a non-null Configuration *and* the designated AppConfigurationEntry within that Configuration for the Zookeeper client. 

This fix is tested with OpenJDK 6:

{code}
java version "1.6.0_24"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.11.4) (amazon-52.1.11.4.46.amzn1-x86_64)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.0-b12, mixed mode)
{code}

Will report on whether this works with OpenJDK 7 soon.

-checks for non-null designated client login AppConfigurationEntry. (rather than just a non-null login Configuration).
-adds client-side test related to login configuration
-adds ZooKeeper:getSaslClient() method so that the above test can work.

Thanks Eugene.

Robert, can you verify this patch as well? 

Thanks

Looks like it works to me.  I haven't had time to do anything in-depth, but I did try the 'connect and do getChildren("/")' program using a jar built with this patch and it succeeded on both OpenJDK 6 and 7 as well as Oracle 6.
Awesome, Ill check this in and kick of the builds on jdk 7 and see if it all works.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12546786/ZOOKEEPER-1550.patch
  against trunk revision 1389711.

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed core unit tests.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

-Remove loginContextName member from ZooKeeperSaslClient; use login.getLoginContextName() instead
